post_title: How poverty rate is higher among immigrants if immigration requires proof of funds/income?

Were not checking if you have enough money to buy a house, were checking if you have enough money to rent. Poverty rates for foreign born people are similar by tenure to UK born people, but higher for social renters than owner occupiers.

post_title: One million top taxpayers pay more than two fifths of all income tax
comment_body: what the hell. When count average salary. It counts working people. But when calculating income tax contributions , it counts all people.
comment_argument: unfair calculation method
llm_argument: the commenter is highlighting what they perceive as an unfair comparison  one that uses different population bases working people vs all people to create a misleading impression of the burden on top taxpayers they suggest the calculation is being manipulated to justify a particular viewpoint

post_title: Millions of workers to be dragged into 40pc income tax band. ‘Fiscal drag’ phenomenon will also mean a further four million on relatively low incomes will be captured by tax system.
comment_body: The government have also made no attempt to fix the 5060k cliff edge for parents, and the 60 marginal rate that applies on incomes between 100 and 120k.
comment_argument: government is not doing something correct to fix this
llm_argument: the comment reinforces the titles concern about the negative effects of fiscal drag and highlights additional tax issues the parent cliff edge and marginal rate that exacerbate the problem demonstrating agreement with the underlying critique of the governments tax policies

post_title: Lowest graduate salaries ‘on a par with minimum wage’ - The shrinking pay gap raises fears that university may be a waste of money for many students and could turn disaffected young people towards political extremes
comment_body: The other side to this was a downplaying of traditional apprenticeship routes towards achieving a fulfilling career. New Labours Education Education Education policy inevitably devalued apprenticeships, contributing to the housing crisis via increased construction costs. University became merely an extension of 6th form and degrees were subsequently devalued forcing graduates to chase a questionable masters degree or PhD in order to distinguish themselves. Nearly all sweeping centralised policies like this lead to unforeseen consequences.
comment_argument: the university system is the other reason causing this
llm_argument: the comment aligns with the titles concern about devalued degrees and career paths arguing that policies prioritizing university education undermined alternatives like apprenticeships contributing to negative outcomes it essentially attributes the problems highlighted in the title to specific policy choices
